meanings.sent1: The nurse was very tender with the newborn baby.
meanings.sent2: She had a tender heart and always helped those in need.
meanings.sent3: The big tough guy surprised everyone by showing a tender side to his pet kitten.
meanings.sent4: Her tender words wrapped around him like a warm blanket on a cold night.
meanings.sent5: The tender smile on her face made everyone feel welcome.

meanings.sent1: He decided to tender his resignation to the company.
meanings.sent2: They will tender their proposal at the upcoming meeting.
meanings.sent3: The magician will tender his amazing tricks for the audience's amazement.
meanings.sent4: She will tender her love to him in a heartfelt letter.
meanings.sent5: The chef will tenderly present the dish to the food critic.

meanings.sent1: The tender flower petals fell with a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent2: The tender skin of the fruit indicated its ripeness.
meanings.sent3: The delicate fabric was so tender that it tore easily.
meanings.sent4: The tender branches of the tree swayed in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The tender leaves crunched underfoot as they walked through the forest.

meanings.sent1: His tender knee throbbed after the fall.
meanings.sent2: She winced as the dentist touched her tender gums.
meanings.sent3: The tender spot on his arm made him yelp when touched.
meanings.sent4: The tender area on her back made her wince with every movement.
meanings.sent5: The tender bruise on his leg made it difficult to walk.

meanings.sent1: He paid for the goods with a stack of tender.
meanings.sent2: The cashier counted the tender in the register at the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: The thief tried to steal the bag of tender from the bank.
meanings.sent4: The vending machine only accepted exact change in tender.
meanings.sent5: She exchanged her foreign currency for local tender at the airport.
